data.title: Send Money Overseas – International Money Transfers
data.meta_description: Send money to Mexico, Central America, the Caribbean, South America, and Asia with Wells Fargo ExpressSend®.
data.text:
Convenient

You can send money through Wells Fargo Online®, the Wells Fargo Phone Bank, or at a Wells Fargo branch location. You may send money for cash pick-up or for credit to an account.

Send money to family or friends in Mexico from an eligible Wells Fargo checking or savings account.

View more information about our ExpressSend Service to Mexico:

How to enroll

Send money to family or friends in Dominican Republic, El Salvador, Guatemala, Honduras, or Nicaragua from an eligible Wells Fargo checking or savings account.

Wells Fargo ExpressSend transfer limits

Learn more about our Remittance Network Members you can use to securely send money

Sender's Rights

The first remittance sent under each service agreement must be completed in person at a Wells Fargo branch. Customers with an existing checking or savings account may be able to complete their first remittance by calling the Wells Fargo Phone Bank, subject to caller authentication requirements and additional fraud prevention controls. Additional remittances may be completed at a Wells Fargo branch, by calling the Wells Fargo Phone Bank, or through Wells Fargo Online® at wellsfargo.com. ExpressSend is not available on the Wells Fargo Mobile® app. Customers must use a desktop or laptop to conduct online ExpressSend transfers.

The credit to account or the cash pick-up delivery methods for remittances may not be available at all Remittance Network Members or locations. When sending money to an account, we will need the beneficiary’s qualifying deposit account number at the Remittance Network Member. When sending money for cash pick up, the beneficiary's name provided by the sender must exactly match the beneficiary's name on their government issued identification.
